ä»Šå¾Œã€å®Ÿè£…ãŒé€²ã‚“ã ã‚‰READMEã«å…·ä½“çš„ãªä½¿ç”¨æ–¹æ³•ã‚„è¨­å®šä¾‹ã‚’è¿½åŠ ã—ã¦ã„ãå½¢ã«ãªã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚

# /commit - Git commit only Claude-edited files

## Purpose
Commit only the files that you (Claude) have edited in the current session, excluding any files modified by others.

## Usage
When the user says "commit", "/commit", or mentions "git commit":

0. ç¦æ­¢äº‹é …ç¢ºèª: `bin/docs/conventions/prohibited_items.md`
1. First run `git status` to see all changed files
2. Identify which files you have edited during this conversation
3. Stage ONLY those files you edited
4. Create a commit with a descriptive message
5. Ensure no other files are accidentally included
6. After commit, check for remaining uncommitted files in current directory (pwd) only
7. If uncommitted files exist in pwd, explain why they weren't included

## Important Rules
- NEVER commit files you didn't edit
- Always verify staged files before committing
- Use the commit message format from bin/docs/conventions/commit_messages.md
- Include the Claude signature in commit messages

## Example Flow
```bash
# 1. Check status
git status

# 2. Reset all staged files
git reset HEAD

# 3. Add only your edited files
git add path/to/your-file1.txt
git add path/to/your-file2.py

# 4. Verify staged files
git status

# 5. Commit with proper message
git commit -m "feat: implement new feature

ğŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>"

# 6. Check for remaining changes in current directory only
git status .

# 7. If uncommitted files exist, explain each:
# - .claude/projects/*.jsonl â†’ Session tracking files (not my edits)
# - bin/src/other/file.py â†’ Modified by another developer/tool
# - test_output.log â†’ Generated file (not source code)
```

## Post-Commit Analysis
After committing, analyze remaining uncommitted files in the current directory (pwd) only:

### Check scope:
- Use `git status .` to check only files in current directory and subdirectories
- Ignore files outside of pwd to focus on relevant changes
- This prevents unnecessary analysis of unrelated project files

### Common reasons for uncommitted files:
1. **Session tracking files** (`.claude/projects/*.jsonl`) - Automatic session logs
2. **Other developer's work** - Files modified by team members or other tools
3. **Generated files** - Build outputs, logs, temporary files
4. **Unrelated changes** - Files outside current task scope
5. **Incomplete work** - Files requiring further modifications

### Working directory focus:
- Only analyze files within pwd and its subdirectories
- Example: If pwd is `/home/nixos/bin/src/poc/`, only check that path
- Skip global repository status to maintain focused analysis

## Key Principle
"Commit only your files except for others" - This ensures clean commit history and prevents accidental inclusion of work done by other developers or tools.
I'll commit only the files I edited in this session.

## ã‚¿ã‚¹ã‚¯é€ä¿¡ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆ
```bash
# 1. å¼•æ•°ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯

echo "é€ä¿¡å…ˆ: $target"

# 5. ã‚¿ã‚¹ã‚¯é€ä¿¡
echo "ã‚¿ã‚¹ã‚¯ã‚’é€ä¿¡ä¸­..."
tmux send-keys -t "$target" "cd '$(pwd)' && [pane:$target] $task" Enter

# 6. é€ä¿¡å¾Œã®çŠ¶æ…‹ç¢ºèª
sleep 0.2  # ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ãŒåæ˜ ã•ã‚Œã‚‹ã¾ã§å°‘ã—å¾…ã¤

# é€ä¿¡å¾Œã®çŠ¶æ…‹ã‚’å–å¾—
post_command=$(tmux list-panes -t "$current_window" -F "#{pane_index} #{pane_current_command}" | grep "^$target_pane " | cut -d' ' -f2-)
echo "é€ä¿¡å¾Œã®çŠ¶æ…‹: $post_command"

# é€ä¿¡å…ˆã®æœ€æ–°å‡ºåŠ›ã‚’è¡¨ç¤º
echo "é€ä¿¡å…ˆã®æœ€æ–°å‡ºåŠ›:"
tmux capture-pane -t "$target" -p | tail -n 10

# é€ä¿¡ç¢ºèªãƒ¡ãƒƒã‚»ãƒ¼ã‚¸
echo "\nâœ“ ã‚¿ã‚¹ã‚¯ãŒæ­£å¸¸ã«é€ä¿¡ã•ã‚Œã¾ã—ãŸ: $target"

- **ç¾åœ¨ä½ç½®ã®è‡ªå‹•å–å¾—**: `tmux display-message -p`ã§ç¾åœ¨ã®window.paneã‚’å®Œå…¨ã«å–å¾—
- **é€ä¿¡å‰ã®çŠ¶æ…‹ç¢ºèª**: é€ä¿¡å…ˆpaneã®ç¾åœ¨ã®ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰çŠ¶æ…‹ã‚’ç¢ºèªãƒ»è¡¨ç¤º

input.content:
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

# Colors for output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Configuration
PROJECT_NAME="${1:-my-nextjs-app}"
DOMAIN="${2:-https://myapp.com}"
CONFIG_FILE="analytics.json"
ENV_FILE=".env.analytics"

# Helper functions
log_info() {
    echo -e "${GREEN}[INFO]${NC} $1"
}

log_warn() {
    echo -e "${YELLOW}[WARN]${NC} $1"
}

log_error() {
    echo -e "${RED}[ERROR]${NC} $1"
}

# 1. Check or create config file
check_config() {
    log_info "Checking analytics configuration..."
    
    if [ ! -f "$CONFIG_FILE" ]; then
        log_warn "Config file not found. Creating new one..."
        cat > "$CONFIG_FILE" <<EOF
{
  "projects": {},
  "templates": {
    "nextjs": "import Script from 'next/script'",
    "waku": "// Waku analytics template"
  }
}
EOF
        log_info "Created $CONFIG_FILE"
    else
        log_info "Found existing $CONFIG_FILE"
    fi
}

# 2. Setup GA4 (simulated)
setup_ga4() {
    local project=$1
    local domain=$2
    
    log_info "Setting up GA4 for $project..."
    echo ""
    echo "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
    echo " GA4 Property Creation (Simulation)"
    echo "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
    echo "Project: $project"
    echo "Domain: $domain"
    echo ""
    
    # Simulate API call
    log_info "Authenticating with Google..."
    sleep 1
    
    log_info "Creating GA4 property..."
    sleep 1
    
    # Generate mock measurement ID
    local measurement_id="G-$(openssl rand -hex 5 | tr '[:lower:]' '[:upper:]')"
    
    log_info "Created property with ID: $measurement_id"
    
    # Save to config
    local config=$(cat "$CONFIG_FILE")
    echo "$config" | jq ".projects.\"$project\".ga4 = \"$measurement_id\"" > "$CONFIG_FILE"
    
    echo "$measurement_id"
}

# 3. Setup Clarity (interactive)
setup_clarity() {
    local project=$1
    
    log_info "Setting up Microsoft Clarity for $project..."
    echo ""
    echo "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
    echo " Clarity Project Setup"
    echo "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
    echo ""
    log_warn "Clarity doesn't have a public API."
    echo "Please create a project at: https://clarity.microsoft.com"
    echo ""
    
    # Simulate manual input
    log_info "Simulating manual Clarity ID input..."
    local clarity_id="$(openssl rand -hex 4)"
    echo "Using simulated Clarity ID: $clarity_id"
    
    # Save to config
    local config=$(cat "$CONFIG_FILE")
    echo "$config" | jq ".projects.\"$project\".clarity = \"$clarity_id\"" > "$CONFIG_FILE"
    
    echo "$clarity_id"
}

# 4. Generate environment file
generate_env() {
    local project=$1
    
    log_info "Generating environment variables..."
    
    local config=$(cat "$CONFIG_FILE" | jq -r ".projects.\"$project\"")
    local ga4=$(echo "$config" | jq -r '.ga4')
    local clarity=$(echo "$config" | jq -r '.clarity')
    
    cat > "$ENV_FILE" <<EOF
# Analytics Configuration for $project
# Generated: $(date)

# Google Analytics 4
NEXT_PUBLIC_GA4_MEASUREMENT_ID=$ga4

# Microsoft Clarity
NEXT_PUBLIC_CLARITY_PROJECT_ID=$clarity

# Environment
NODE_ENV=production
EOF
    
    log_info "Created $ENV_FILE"
}

# 5. Generate React component
generate_component() {
    local project=$1
    
    log_info "Generating Analytics component..."
    
    local config=$(cat "$CONFIG_FILE" | jq -r ".projects.\"$project\"")
    local ga4=$(echo "$config" | jq -r '.ga4')
    local clarity=$(echo "$config" | jq -r '.clarity')
    
    cat > "Analytics.tsx" <<EOF
'use client'
import Script from 'next/script'

export function Analytics() {
  const GA4_ID = process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_GA4_MEASUREMENT_ID || '$ga4'
  const CLARITY_ID = process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_CLARITY_PROJECT_ID || '$clarity'
  
  return (
    <>
      {/* Google Analytics 4 */}
      <Script
        src={\`https://www.googletagmanager.com/gtag/js?id=\${GA4_ID}\`}
        strategy="afterInteractive"
      />
      <Script id="google-analytics" strategy="afterInteractive">
        {\`
          window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];
          function gtag(){dataLayer.push(arguments);}
          gtag('js', new Date());
          gtag('config', '\${GA4_ID}');
        \`}
      </Script>
      
      {/* Microsoft Clarity */}
      <Script id="clarity-analytics" strategy="afterInteractive">
        {\`
          (function(c,l,a,r,i,t,y){
            c[a]=c[a]||function(){(c[a].q=c[a].q||[]).push(arguments)};
            t=l.createElement(r);t.async=1;t.src="https://www.clarity.ms/tag/"+i;
            y=l.getElementsByTagName(r)[0];y.parentNode.insertBefore(t,y);
          })(window, document, "clarity", "script", "\${CLARITY_ID}");
        \`}
      </Script>
    </>
  )
}
EOF
    
    log_info "Created Analytics.tsx component"
}

# 6. Show summary
show_summary() {
    local project=$1
    
    echo ""
    echo "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
    echo " âœ… Setup Complete!"
    echo "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
    echo ""
    
    local config=$(cat "$CONFIG_FILE" | jq -r ".projects.\"$project\"")
    
    echo "ğŸ“Š Configuration for: $project"
    echo "â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€"
    echo "$config" | jq .
    echo ""
    
    echo "ğŸ“ Generated files:"
    echo "  â€¢ $CONFIG_FILE - Configuration database"
    echo "  â€¢ $ENV_FILE - Environment variables"  
    echo "  â€¢ Analytics.tsx - React component"
    echo ""
    
    echo "ğŸš€ Next steps:"
    echo "  1. Add Analytics component to your layout.tsx"
    echo "  2. Deploy with environment variables"
    echo "  3. Verify in GA4 Real-time view"
}

# Main execution
main() {
    log_info "Starting Analytics Setup Script"
    log_info "Project: $PROJECT_NAME, Domain: $DOMAIN"
    echo ""

}

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

# Colors for output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Configuration
PROJECT_NAME="${1:-my-nextjs-app}"
DOMAIN="${2:-https://myapp.com}"
CONFIG_FILE="analytics.json"
ENV_FILE=".env.analytics"

# Helper functions
log_info() {
    echo -e "${GREEN}[INFO]${NC} $1"
}

log_warn() {
    echo -e "${YELLOW}[WARN]${NC} $1"
}

log_error() {
    echo -e "${RED}[ERROR]${NC} $1"
}

# 1. Check or create config file
check_config() {
    log_info "Checking analytics configuration..."
    
    if [ ! -f "$CONFIG_FILE" ]; then
        log_warn "Config file not found. Creating new one..."
        cat > "$CONFIG_FILE" <<EOF
{
  "projects": {},
  "templates": {
    "nextjs": "import Script from 'next/script'",
    "waku": "// Waku analytics template"
  }
}
EOF
        log_info "Created $CONFIG_FILE"
    else
        log_info "Found existing $CONFIG_FILE"
    fi
}

# 2. Setup GA4 (simulated)
setup_ga4() {
    local project=$1
    local domain=$2
    
    log_info "Setting up GA4 for $project..."
    echo ""
    echo "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
    echo " GA4 Property Creation (Simulation)"
    echo "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
    echo "Project: $project"
    echo "Domain: $domain"
    echo ""
    
    # Simulate API call
    log_info "Authenticating with Google..."
    sleep 1
    
    log_info "Creating GA4 property..."
    sleep 1
    
    # Generate mock measurement ID
    local measurement_id="G-$(openssl rand -hex 5 | tr '[:lower:]' '[:upper:]')"
    
    log_info "Created property with ID: $measurement_id"
    
    # Save to config
    local config=$(cat "$CONFIG_FILE")
    echo "$config" | jq ".projects.\"$project\".ga4 = \"$measurement_id\"" > "$CONFIG_FILE"
    
    echo "$measurement_id"
}

# 3. Setup Clarity (interactive)
setup_clarity() {
    local project=$1
    
    log_info "Setting up Microsoft Clarity for $project..."
    echo ""
    echo "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
    echo " Clarity Project Setup"
    echo "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
    echo ""
    log_warn "Clarity doesn't have a public API."
    echo "Please create a project at: https://clarity.microsoft.com"
    echo ""
    
    # Simulate manual input
    log_info "Simulating manual Clarity ID input..."
    local clarity_id="$(openssl rand -hex 4)"
    echo "Using simulated Clarity ID: $clarity_id"
    
    # Save to config
    local config=$(cat "$CONFIG_FILE")
    echo "$config" | jq ".projects.\"$project\".clarity = \"$clarity_id\"" > "$CONFIG_FILE"
    
    echo "$clarity_id"
}

# 4. Generate environment file
generate_env() {
    local project=$1
    
    log_info "Generating environment variables..."
    
    local config=$(cat "$CONFIG_FILE" | jq -r ".projects.\"$project\"")
    local ga4=$(echo "$config" | jq -r '.ga4')
    local clarity=$(echo "$config" | jq -r '.clarity')
    
    cat > "$ENV_FILE" <<EOF
# Analytics Configuration for $project
# Generated: $(date)

# Google Analytics 4
NEXT_PUBLIC_GA4_MEASUREMENT_ID=$ga4

# Microsoft Clarity
NEXT_PUBLIC_CLARITY_PROJECT_ID=$clarity

# Environment
NODE_ENV=production
EOF
    
    log_info "Created $ENV_FILE"
}

# 5. Generate React component
generate_component() {
    local project=$1
    
    log_info "Generating Analytics component..."
    
    local config=$(cat "$CONFIG_FILE" | jq -r ".projects.\"$project\"")
    local ga4=$(echo "$config" | jq -r '.ga4')
    local clarity=$(echo "$config" | jq -r '.clarity')
    
    cat > "Analytics.tsx" <<EOF
'use client'
import Script from 'next/script'

export function Analytics() {
  const GA4_ID = process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_GA4_MEASUREMENT_ID || '$ga4'
  const CLARITY_ID = process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_CLARITY_PROJECT_ID || '$clarity'
  
  return (
    <>
      {/* Google Analytics 4 */}
      <Script
        src={\`https://www.googletagmanager.com/gtag/js?id=\${GA4_ID}\`}
        strategy="afterInteractive"
      />
      <Script id="google-analytics" strategy="afterInteractive">
        {\`
          window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];
          function gtag(){dataLayer.push(arguments);}
          gtag('js', new Date());
          gtag('config', '\${GA4_ID}');
        \`}
      </Script>
      
      {/* Microsoft Clarity */}
      <Script id="clarity-analytics" strategy="afterInteractive">
        {\`
          (function(c,l,a,r,i,t,y){
            c[a]=c[a]||function(){(c[a].q=c[a].q||[]).push(arguments)};
            t=l.createElement(r);t.async=1;t.src="https://www.clarity.ms/tag/"+i;
            y=l.getElementsByTagName(r)[0];y.parentNode.insertBefore(t,y);
          })(window, document, "clarity", "script", "\${CLARITY_ID}");
        \`}
      </Script>
    </>
  )
}
EOF
    
    log_info "Created Analytics.tsx component"
}

# 6. Show summary
show_summary() {
    local project=$1
    
    echo ""
    echo "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
    echo " âœ… Setup Complete!"
    echo "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
    echo ""
    
    local config=$(cat "$CONFIG_FILE" | jq -r ".projects.\"$project\"")
    
    echo "ğŸ“Š Configuration for: $project"
    echo "â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€"
    echo "$config" | jq .
    echo ""
    
    echo "ğŸ“ Generated files:"
    echo "  â€¢ $CONFIG_FILE - Configuration database"
    echo "  â€¢ $ENV_FILE - Environment variables"  
    echo "  â€¢ Analytics.tsx - React component"
    echo ""
    
    echo "ğŸš€ Next steps:"
    echo "  1. Add Analytics component to your layout.tsx"
    echo "  2. Deploy with environment variables"
    echo "  3. Verify in GA4 Real-time view"
}

# Main execution
main() {
    log_info "Starting Analytics Setup Script"
    log_info "Project: $PROJECT_NAME, Domain: $DOMAIN"
    echo ""
    
    check_config
    
    ga4_id=$(setup_ga4 "$PROJECT_NAME" "$DOMAIN")
    clarity_id=$(setup_clarity "$PROJECT_NAME")
    
    generate_env "$PROJECT_NAME"
    generate_component "$PROJECT_NAME"
    
    show_summary "$PROJECT_NAME"
}

# Run if not sourced
if [ "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" = "${0}" ]; then
    main "$@"
fi

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

# Configuration
PROPERTY_NAME="Waku Workers Project"
SITE_URL="https://waku-project.secretx.workers.dev/"
TIME_ZONE="Asia/Tokyo"
CURRENCY="JPY"

echo "ğŸ“Š Creating GA4 Property"
echo "========================"
echo "Name: $PROPERTY_NAME"
echo "URL: $SITE_URL"
echo ""

# Get access token
echo "Getting access token..."
ACCESS_TOKEN=$(gcloud auth print-access-token)

# First, list available accounts
echo "Fetching GA4 accounts..."
ACCOUNTS=$(curl -s -X GET \
  "https://analyticsadmin.googleapis.com/v1beta/accounts" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $ACCESS_TOKEN" \
  -H "Accept: application/json")

echo "Available accounts:"
echo "$ACCOUNTS" | jq -r '.accounts[] | "\(.name) - \(.displayName)"' 2>/dev/null || echo "No accounts found or error parsing"

# Get first account (or create if none)
ACCOUNT_NAME=$(echo "$ACCOUNTS" | jq -r '.accounts[0].name' 2>/dev/null)

if [ "$ACCOUNT_NAME" == "null" ] || [ -z "$ACCOUNT_NAME" ]; then
  echo "No GA4 account found. You need to create one at https://analytics.google.com first"
  exit 1
fi

echo ""
echo "Using account: $ACCOUNT_NAME"

# Create property
echo "Creating property..."
PROPERTY_RESPONSE=$(curl -s -X POST \
  "https://analyticsadmin.googleapis.com/v1beta/${ACCOUNT_NAME}/properties" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $ACCESS_TOKEN" \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d "{
    \"displayName\": \"$PROPERTY_NAME\",
    \"timeZone\": \"$TIME_ZONE\",
    \"currencyCode\": \"$CURRENCY\",
    \"propertyType\": \"PROPERTY_TYPE_ORDINARY\",
    \"industryCategory\": \"TECHNOLOGY\"
  }")

echo "Property response:"
echo "$PROPERTY_RESPONSE" | jq . 2>/dev/null || echo "$PROPERTY_RESPONSE"

# Extract property name/ID
PROPERTY_ID=$(echo "$PROPERTY_RESPONSE" | jq -r '.name' 2>/dev/null)

if [ "$PROPERTY_ID" == "null" ] || [ -z "$PROPERTY_ID" ]; then
  echo "Failed to create property"
  exit 1
fi

echo ""
echo "Property created: $PROPERTY_ID"

# Create web data stream
echo "Creating web data stream..."
STREAM_RESPONSE=$(curl -s -X POST \
  "https://analyticsadmin.googleapis.com/v1beta/${PROPERTY_ID}/dataStreams" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $ACCESS_TOKEN" \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d "{
    \"displayName\": \"Web Stream - $PROPERTY_NAME\",
    \"type\": \"WEB_DATA_STREAM\",
    \"webStreamData\": {
      \"defaultUri\": \"$SITE_URL\"
    }
  }")

echo "Stream response:"
echo "$STREAM_RESPONSE" | jq . 2>/dev/null || echo "$STREAM_RESPONSE"

# Extract measurement ID
MEASUREMENT_ID=$(echo "$STREAM_RESPONSE" | jq -r '.webStreamData.measurementId' 2>/dev/null)

if [ "$MEASUREMENT_ID" == "null" ] || [ -z "$MEASUREMENT_ID" ]; then
  echo "Failed to get measurement ID"
  exit 1
fi

echo ""
echo "âœ… Success!"
echo "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
echo "Measurement ID: $MEASUREMENT_ID"
echo "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
echo ""
echo "Add this to your environment:"
echo "NEXT_PUBLIC_GA_MEASUREMENT_ID=$MEASUREMENT_ID"

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

# Configuration
PROPERTY_NAME="Waku Workers Project"
SITE_URL="https://waku-project.secretx.workers.dev/"
TIME_ZONE="Asia/Tokyo"
CURRENCY="JPY"

echo "ğŸ“Š Creating GA4 Property"
echo "========================"
echo "Name: $PROPERTY_NAME"
echo "URL: $SITE_URL"
echo ""

# Get access token
echo "Getting access token..."
ACCESS_TOKEN=$(gcloud auth print-access-token)

# First, list available accounts
echo "Fetching GA4 accounts..."
ACCOUNTS=$(curl -s -X GET \
  "https://analyticsadmin.googleapis.com/v1beta/accounts" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $ACCESS_TOKEN" \
  -H "Accept: application/json")

echo "Available accounts:"
echo "$ACCOUNTS" | jq -r '.accounts[] | "\(.name) - \(.displayName)"' 2>/dev/null || echo "No accounts found or error parsing"

# Get first account (or create if none)
ACCOUNT_NAME=$(echo "$ACCOUNTS" | jq -r '.accounts[0].name' 2>/dev/null)

if [ "$ACCOUNT_NAME" == "null" ] || [ -z "$ACCOUNT_NAME" ]; then
  echo "No GA4 account found. You need to create one at https://analytics.google.com first"
  exit 1
fi

echo ""
echo "Using account: $ACCOUNT_NAME"

# Create property
echo "Creating property..."
PROPERTY_RESPONSE=$(curl -s -X POST \
  "https://analyticsadmin.googleapis.com/v1beta/${ACCOUNT_NAME}/properties" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $ACCESS_TOKEN" \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d "{
    \"displayName\": \"$PROPERTY_NAME\",
    \"timeZone\": \"$TIME_ZONE\",
    \"currencyCode\": \"$CURRENCY\",
    \"propertyType\": \"PROPERTY_TYPE_ORDINARY\",
    \"industryCategory\": \"TECHNOLOGY\"
  }")

echo "Property response:"
echo "$PROPERTY_RESPONSE" | jq . 2>/dev/null || echo "$PROPERTY_RESPONSE"

# Extract property name/ID
PROPERTY_ID=$(echo "$PROPERTY_RESPONSE" | jq -r '.name' 2>/dev/null)

if [ "$PROPERTY_ID" == "null" ] || [ -z "$PROPERTY_ID" ]; then
  echo "Failed to create property"
  exit 1
fi

echo ""
echo "Property created: $PROPERTY_ID"

# Create web data stream
echo "Creating web data stream..."
STREAM_RESPONSE=$(curl -s -X POST \
  "https://analyticsadmin.googleapis.com/v1beta/${PROPERTY_ID}/dataStreams" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $ACCESS_TOKEN" \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d "{
    \"displayName\": \"Web Stream - $PROPERTY_NAME\",
    \"type\": \"WEB_DATA_STREAM\",
    \"webStreamData\": {
      \"defaultUri\": \"$SITE_URL\"
    }
  }")

echo "Stream response:"
echo "$STREAM_RESPONSE" | jq . 2>/dev/null || echo "$STREAM_RESPONSE"

# Extract measurement ID
MEASUREMENT_ID=$(echo "$STREAM_RESPONSE" | jq -r '.webStreamData.measurementId' 2>/dev/null)

if [ "$MEASUREMENT_ID" == "null" ] || [ -z "$MEASUREMENT_ID" ]; then
  echo "Failed to get measurement ID"
  exit 1
fi

echo ""
echo "âœ… Success!"
echo "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
echo "Measurement ID: $MEASUREMENT_ID"
echo "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
echo ""
echo "Add this to your environment:"
echo "NEXT_PUBLIC_GA_MEASUREMENT_ID=$MEASUREMENT_ID"

Based on my search results, I can see that there isn't currently a native Terraform resource called `google_analytics_admin_account` for creating GA4 accounts directly. Let me provide you with the information I found:

## Current State of Terraform Support for Google Analytics 4

There is currently no native Terraform resource to manage Google Analytics properties or accounts. A google_analytics_property resource has been requested as crucial for automating the setup and management of Google Analytics within Google Cloud projects, particularly when integrated with Firebase.

## Alternative Approaches

### 1. Google Analytics Admin API
You can create GA4 analytics accounts at scale using the Google Analytics Admin API. The API requires account provisioning which returns an accountTicketId that must be used with a Terms of Service URL for the user to accept the Terms of Service.

### 2. Firebase Integration
Firebase is beginning to support Terraform, and if you're on a team that wants to automate creating Firebase projects with specific resources, using Terraform with Firebase can be a good fit. However, this doesn't directly provide GA4 account creation capabilities.

### 3. Manual Setup Required
To create a GA4 property manually, you need to go to Admin, click Create, select Property, and enter a name for the property along with reporting time zone and currency.

## Community Status
There's an open feature request on GitHub (Issue #16898) for adding Google Analytics resource support to the Terraform Google provider. The community is actively requesting this functionality, but it hasn't been implemented yet.

## Workaround Options
1. Use the Google Analytics Admin API directly with custom scripts
2. Create GA4 accounts manually and then reference them in Terraform
3. Use Firebase projects with linked GA4 properties (though this still requires manual GA4 account creation)

results:
Based on my search results, I can see that there isn't currently a native Terraform resource called `google_analytics_admin_account` for creating GA4 accounts directly. Let me provide you with the information I found:

## Current State of Terraform Support for Google Analytics 4

There is currently no native Terraform resource to manage Google Analytics properties or accounts. A google_analytics_property resource has been requested as crucial for automating the setup and management of Google Analytics within Google Cloud projects, particularly when integrated with Firebase.

## Alternative Approaches

### 1. Google Analytics Admin API
You can create GA4 analytics accounts at scale using the Google Analytics Admin API. The API requires account provisioning which returns an accountTicketId that must be used with a Terms of Service URL for the user to accept the Terms of Service.

### 2. Firebase Integration
Firebase is beginning to support Terraform, and if you're on a team that wants to automate creating Firebase projects with specific resources, using Terraform with Firebase can be a good fit. However, this doesn't directly provide GA4 account creation capabilities.

### 3. Manual Setup Required
To create a GA4 property manually, you need to go to Admin, click Create, select Property, and enter a name for the property along with reporting time zone and currency.

## Community Status
There's an open feature request on GitHub (Issue #16898) for adding Google Analytics resource support to the Terraform Google provider. The community is actively requesting this functionality, but it hasn't been implemented yet.

## Workaround Options
1. Use the Google Analytics Admin API directly with custom scripts
2. Create GA4 accounts manually and then reference them in Terraform
3. Use Firebase projects with linked GA4 properties (though this still requires manual GA4 account creation)

Currently, fully automated GA4 account creation through Terraform isn't supported, and you'll need to use the Google Analytics Admin API or manual setup for account creation.

Based on the search results, I can provide you with information about programmatically creating Google Analytics GA4 accounts and working with Pulumi:

## Key Findings:

### Google Analytics Admin API for GA4 Account Creation

The Google Analytics Admin API allows for programmatic access to Google Analytics configuration data and is compatible with Google Analytics properties. It can provision new accounts. Once a user visits the TOS URL and accepts the Terms of Service, creation of a Google Analytics account will be complete.

The Admin API provides capabilities to:
- Manage accounts and properties
- Manage data sharing settings
- Manage streams
- Manage custom dimensions and metrics

### Pulumi for Google Cloud Platform

The Google Cloud Platform (GCP) resource provider for Pulumi lets you use GCP resources in your cloud programs. Pulumi's Automation API enables you to provision your infrastructure programmatically using the Pulumi engine by exposing Pulumi programs and stacks as strongly-typed and composable building blocks.

### Important Considerations:

1. **Google Analytics Admin API**: While the Admin API can provision new GA4 accounts programmatically, the user must accept the Terms of Service via a TOS URL to complete account creation.

2. **API Enablement Required**: To access Google Analytics data programmatically, you'll need the Google Analytics 4 Reporting API and the Management API (optional). You need to enable "Google Analytics for Reporting API" and "Google Analytics Admin API".

3. **Authentication**: To access your Google Analytics data securely, you'll need to create a service account and generate credentials in JSON format.

4. **Pulumi GCP Provider**: While Pulumi has extensive support for Google Cloud Platform services, the search results don't show direct Pulumi resources specifically for Google Analytics GA4 account creation. You would likely need to use Pulumi's ability to make API calls or integrate with the Google Analytics Admin API directly.

### Recommendation:

To programmatically create GA4 accounts with Pulumi, you would need to:
1. Use the Google Analytics Admin API for account provisioning
2. Implement the API calls within your Pulumi program using HTTP requests or Google's client libraries
3. Handle the Terms of Service acceptance requirement (which requires user interaction)
4. Use Pulumi's GCP provider for related Google Cloud infrastructure needs

The direct creation of GA4 accounts appears to require using Google's Admin API rather than having native Pulumi resources for this specific task.

cat << 'EOF' > create-property.py
#!/usr/bin/env python3
import json
import subprocess
import sys

def get_token():
    result = subprocess.run(['gcloud', 'auth', 'print-access-token'], 
                          capture_output=True, text=True)
    return result.stdout.strip()

def list_accounts(token):
    import urllib.request
    req = urllib.request.Request(
        'https://analyticsadmin.googleapis.com/v1beta/accounts',
        headers={'Authorization': f'Bearer {token}'}
    )
    with urllib.request.urlopen(req) as response:
        return json.loads(response.read())

def create_property(account_name, property_name, token):
    import urllib.request
    data = json.dumps({
        'displayName': property_name,
        'timeZone': 'Asia/Tokyo',
        'currencyCode': 'JPY'
    }).encode()
    
    req = urllib.request.Request(
        f'https://analyticsadmin.googleapis.com/v1beta/{account_name}/properties',
        data=data,
        headers={
            'Authorization': f'Bearer {token}',
            'Content-Type': 'application/json'
        }
    )
    with urllib.request.urlopen(req) as response:
        return json.loads(response.read())

def create_stream(property_name, url, token):
    import urllib.request
    data = json.dumps({
        'displayName': 'Web Stream',
        'type': 'WEB_DATA_STREAM',
        'webStreamData': {'defaultUri': url}
    }).encode()
    
    req = urllib.request.Request(
        f'https://analyticsadmin.googleapis.com/v1beta/{property_name}/dataStreams',
        data=data,
        headers={
            'Authorization': f'Bearer {token}',
            'Content-Type': 'application/json'
        }
    )
    with urllib.request.urlopen(req) as response:
        return json.loads(response.read())

if __name__ == '__main__':
    project_name = sys.argv[1] if len(sys.argv) > 1 else 'My Project'
    domain = sys.argv[2] if len(sys.argv) > 2 else 'https://example.com'
    
    token = get_token()
    
    # Get account
    accounts = list_accounts(token)
    if not accounts.get('accounts'):
        print("âŒ No GA4 account found. Please create one first.")
        sys.exit(1)
    
    account = accounts['accounts'][0]
    print(f"Using account: {account['displayName']}")
    
    # Create property
    property_resp = create_property(account['name'], project_name, token)
    print(f"Created property: {property_resp['displayName']}")
    
    # Create stream
    stream_resp = create_stream(property_resp['name'], domain, token)
    measurement_id = stream_resp['webStreamData']['measurementId']
    
    print(f"\nâœ… Measurement ID: {measurement_id}")
    
    # Save to file
    with open('.env.ga4', 'w') as f:
        f.write(f"NEXT_PUBLIC_GA_MEASUREMENT_ID={measurement_id}\n")
EOF

chmod +x create-property.py

# Step 4: ã‚¢ã‚«ã‚¦ãƒ³ãƒˆIDå–å¾—ã¨ãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒ‘ãƒ†ã‚£ä½œæˆï¼ˆè‡ªå‹•ï¼‰

#!/usr/bin/env python3
import json
import subprocess
import sys

def get_token():
    result = subprocess.run(['gcloud', 'auth', 'print-access-token'], 
                          capture_output=True, text=True)
    return result.stdout.strip()

def list_accounts(token):
    import urllib.request
    req = urllib.request.Request(
        'https://analyticsadmin.googleapis.com/v1beta/accounts',
        headers={'Authorization': f'Bearer {token}'}
    )
    with urllib.request.urlopen(req) as response:
        return json.loads(response.read())

def create_property(account_name, property_name, token):
    import urllib.request
    data = json.dumps({
        'displayName': property_name,
        'timeZone': 'Asia/Tokyo',
        'currencyCode': 'JPY'
    }).encode()
    
    req = urllib.request.Request(
        f'https://analyticsadmin.googleapis.com/v1beta/{account_name}/properties',
        data=data,
        headers={
            'Authorization': f'Bearer {token}',
            'Content-Type': 'application/json'
        }
    )
    with urllib.request.urlopen(req) as response:
        return json.loads(response.read())

def create_stream(property_name, url, token):
    import urllib.request
    data = json.dumps({
        'displayName': 'Web Stream',
        'type': 'WEB_DATA_STREAM',
        'webStreamData': {'defaultUri': url}
    }).encode()
    
    req = urllib.request.Request(
        f'https://analyticsadmin.googleapis.com/v1beta/{property_name}/dataStreams',
        data=data,
        headers={
            'Authorization': f'Bearer {token}',
            'Content-Type': 'application/json'
        }
    )
    with urllib.request.urlopen(req) as response:
        return json.loads(response.read())

if __name__ == '__main__':
    project_name = sys.argv[1] if len(sys.argv) > 1 else 'My Project'
    domain = sys.argv[2] if len(sys.argv) > 2 else 'https://example.com'
    
    token = get_token()
    
    # Get account
    accounts = list_accounts(token)
    if not accounts.get('accounts'):
        print("âŒ No GA4 account found. Please create one first.")
        sys.exit(1)
    
    account = accounts['accounts'][0]
    print(f"Using account: {account['displayName']}")
    
    # Create property
    property_resp = create_property(account['name'], project_name, token)
    print(f"Created property: {property_resp['displayName']}")
    
    # Create stream
    stream_resp = create_stream(property_resp['name'], domain, token)
    measurement_id = stream_resp['webStreamData']['measurementId']
    
    print(f"\nâœ… Measurement ID: {measurement_id}")
    
    # Save to file
    with open('.env.ga4', 'w') as f:
        f.write(f"NEXT_PUBLIC_GA_MEASUREMENT_ID={measurement_id}\n")
EOF

echo ""

echo "2. GA4ã‚¢ã‚«ã‚¦ãƒ³ãƒˆã‚’æ‰‹å‹•ä½œæˆ"

## ã‚¿ã‚¹ã‚¯é€ä¿¡ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆ

  echo "ä½¿ç”¨æ–¹æ³•: /tmux <paneç•ªå·> <ã‚¿ã‚¹ã‚¯>"
  echo "ä¾‹: /tmux 1 \"ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆã‚’å®Ÿè¡Œã—ã¦\""

target_pane="$1"

# 2. ç¾åœ¨ã®window.paneã‚’å–å¾—
current_location=$(tmux display-message -p '#{window_index}.#{pane_index}')
current_window=$(echo "$current_location" | cut -d. -f1)

if ! [[ "$target_pane" =~ ^[0-9]+$ ]]; then

### Step 1: ãƒ¢ãƒƒã‚¯å®Ÿè£…ã®å‰Šé™¤
**1.1 ä¾¡å€¤ã®æ˜æ–‡åŒ–ï¼ˆWHYï¼‰**

```

### Step 2: å®ŸAPIå‘¼ã³å‡ºã—å®Ÿè£…
**2.1 ä¾¡å€¤ã®æ˜æ–‡åŒ–ï¼ˆWHYï¼‰**
- å®Ÿéš›ã®GA4æ¸¬å®šIDå–å¾—

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

# å®Ÿéš›ã®GA4 APIå‘¼ã³å‡ºã—ã®ã¿ã‚’è¡Œã†ã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªãƒ—ãƒˆ
# ãƒ¢ãƒƒã‚¯ãƒ»ãƒ€ãƒŸãƒ¼ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã¯ä¸€åˆ‡ä½¿ç”¨ã—ãªã„

PROJECT_NAME="${1:-waku-project}"
DOMAIN="${2:-https://waku-project.secretx.workers.dev/}"

echo "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
echo " GA4 å®ŸAPIå‘¼ã³å‡ºã—"
echo "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
echo ""

# å‰ææ¡ä»¶ç¢ºèª
if ! command -v gcloud &> /dev/null; then
    echo "âŒ Error: gcloud CLI required"
    echo "Install: nix shell nixpkgs#google-cloud-sdk"
    exit 1
fi

# èªè¨¼ç¢ºèª
AUTH_STATUS=$(gcloud auth list --format="value(account)" 2>/dev/null)
if [ -z "$AUTH_STATUS" ]; then
    echo "âŒ Error: Not authenticated"
    echo "Run: gcloud auth login"
    exit 1
fi

echo "âœ… Authenticated as: $AUTH_STATUS"
echo ""

# GA4ã‚¢ã‚«ã‚¦ãƒ³ãƒˆå–å¾—ï¼ˆå®ŸAPIï¼‰
echo "Fetching GA4 accounts..."
ACCOUNTS=$(curl -s -X GET \
    "https://analyticsadmin.googleapis.com/v1beta/accounts" \
    -H "Authorization: Bearer $(gcloud auth print-access-token)" \
    -H "Accept: application/json")

# ã‚¢ã‚«ã‚¦ãƒ³ãƒˆå­˜åœ¨ç¢ºèª
ACCOUNT_NAME=$(echo "$ACCOUNTS" | jq -r '.accounts[0].name' 2>/dev/null)

if [ "$ACCOUNT_NAME" == "null" ] || [ -z "$ACCOUNT_NAME" ]; then
    echo "âŒ GA4 account required"
    echo ""
    echo "Manual action needed:"
    echo "1. Go to https://analytics.google.com"
    echo "2. Create account and accept Terms of Service"
    echo "3. Run this script again"
    exit 1
fi

echo "âœ… Found account: $ACCOUNT_NAME"
echo ""

# ãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒ‘ãƒ†ã‚£ä½œæˆï¼ˆå®ŸAPIï¼‰
echo "Creating property..."
PROPERTY_RESPONSE=$(curl -s -X POST \
    "https://analyticsadmin.googleapis.com/v1beta/${ACCOUNT_NAME}/properties" \
    -H "Authorization: Bearer $(gcloud auth print-access-token)" \
    -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
    -d "{
        \"displayName\": \"$PROJECT_NAME\",
        \"timeZone\": \"Asia/Tokyo\",
        \"currencyCode\": \"JPY\"
    }")

PROPERTY_NAME=$(echo "$PROPERTY_RESPONSE" | jq -r '.name' 2>/dev/null)

if [ "$PROPERTY_NAME" == "null" ] || [ -z "$PROPERTY_NAME" ]; then
    echo "âŒ Failed to create property"
    echo "$PROPERTY_RESPONSE"
    exit 1
fi

echo "âœ… Created property: $PROPERTY_NAME"
echo ""

# ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒªãƒ¼ãƒ ä½œæˆï¼ˆå®ŸAPIï¼‰
echo "Creating data stream..."
STREAM_RESPONSE=$(curl -s -X POST \
    "https://analyticsadmin.googleapis.com/v1beta/${PROPERTY_NAME}/dataStreams" \
    -H "Authorization: Bearer $(gcloud auth print-access-token)" \
    -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
    -d "{
        \"displayName\": \"Web Stream\",
        \"type\": \"WEB_DATA_STREAM\",
        \"webStreamData\": {
            \"defaultUri\": \"$DOMAIN\"
        }
    }")

# å®Ÿéš›ã®æ¸¬å®šIDå–å¾—
MEASUREMENT_ID=$(echo "$STREAM_RESPONSE" | jq -r '.webStreamData.measurementId' 2>/dev/null)

if [ "$MEASUREMENT_ID" == "null" ] || [ -z "$MEASUREMENT_ID" ]; then
    echo "âŒ Failed to get measurement ID"
    echo "$STREAM_RESPONSE"
    exit 1
fi

# å®Ÿéš›ã®å€¤ã‚’ç’°å¢ƒå¤‰æ•°ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã«ä¿å­˜
cat > .env.production << EOF
# GA4 Configuration (Actual Values)
# Generated: $(date -I)
NEXT_PUBLIC_GA_MEASUREMENT_ID=$MEASUREMENT_ID
NEXT_PUBLIC_SITE_URL=$DOMAIN
EOF

echo "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
echo " âœ… Success!"
echo "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
echo ""
echo "Actual Measurement ID: $MEASUREMENT_ID"
echo "Saved to: .env.production"
